columns.Film_ID: A unique identifier for each film in the database.
columns.Rank_in_series: Indicates the rank position of the film within its series.
columns.Number_in_season: Specifies the sequence number of the film within its season.
columns.Title: The name of the film.
columns.Directed_by: The name of the director responsible for creating the film.
columns.Original_air_date: The dates during which the film originally aired.
columns.Production_code: A code that identifies the production sequence of the film.

film.table_description: The 'film' table contains information about various films, including their unique identifiers, rankings within series and seasons, titles, directors, original air dates, and production codes.

columns.Cinema_ID: A unique identifier for each cinema in the database.
columns.Name: The name of the cinema, representing its brand or title.
columns.Openning_year: The year in which the cinema was established and began operations.
columns.Capacity: The maximum number of patrons that the cinema can accommodate at any given time.
columns.Location: The geographical area or county where the cinema is situated.

cinema.table_description: The cinema table stores information about different cinema locations, including their unique identifiers, names, opening years, seating capacities, and geographical locations.

columns.Cinema_ID: Identifies the specific cinema where the film is being shown.
columns.Film_ID: Identifies the particular film being scheduled for screening.
columns.Date: Specifies the date on which the film is scheduled to be shown.
columns.Show_times_per_day: Indicates the number of times the film is slated to be shown on the specified date.
columns.Price: Represents the ticket price for attending the screening of the film on that date.

schedule.table_description: The schedule table maintains a record of film screenings at various cinemas, detailing the specific show dates, the frequency of showings for each film, and the corresponding ticket prices.
